description: Risk classification and arena execution policy per skill. Determines whether tasks run as single-session or multi-session (arena) verification.

legacy-analysis.rationale: Incorrect modernization assessment leads to flawed migration roadmaps. Multi-session verification ensures architecture and dependency analysis is consistent across independent analyses.

plsql-migration.rationale: Oracle-to-PostgreSQL migration involves subtle semantic differences (NULL handling, date behavior, transaction boundaries) that benefit from independent verification of conversion correctness.

cobol-conversion.rationale: COBOL numeric precision, packed decimal handling, and implicit fall-through control flow are common sources of conversion errors. Independent sessions catch different edge cases.

db-rationalization.rationale: Database rationalization across 3,000 instances is highest-risk modernization activity. Incorrect consolidation recommendations can cause data loss, referential integrity violations, and cross-LOB disruptions. Triple verification required.

security-scan.rationale: Missed security findings can block compliance certification renewals and expose critical national infrastructure. False negatives in CIS Benchmark compliance scanning are unacceptable. Triple verification ensures comprehensive coverage.

test-generation.rationale: Test generation output is validated by execution — tests either pass or fail. The built-in verification (running the tests) serves as the primary quality gate.

feature-dev.rationale: Feature development follows the SDD→TDD→Build→Review pipeline with multiple verification checkpoints. Arena verification is available for safety-critical features.

pr-review.rationale: PR review is itself a verification step. The reviewed code has already been through the build pipeline. Additional arena sessions add cost without proportional risk reduction.

incident-response.rationale: Incorrect root cause analysis leads to wrong fixes deployed to production, potentially worsening the incident. Multiple independent investigations increase the probability of finding the true root cause.

parallel-migration.rationale: Each parallel session is individually verified. The pilot batch mechanism serves as the arena equivalent — the first 10 sessions validate the transformation rules before scaling.

api-modernization.rationale: API contract changes affect all downstream consumers. Independent verification sessions catch contract inconsistencies and backward compatibility breaks.

containerization.rationale: Containerization output is validated by build, scan, and deploy verification. The Trivy scan and container health check serve as deterministic quality gates.

sdlc-validator.rationale: SDLC validation is deterministic — gates pass or fail based on artifact presence and test results. No subjective analysis that benefits from multiple perspectives.

guardrail-auditor.rationale: Guardrail auditing polls a deterministic API and classifies violations against defined rules. No ambiguity that benefits from arena verification.

skill-creator.rationale: Skill creation output is validated by the skills parser and validator. The validation tooling provides deterministic quality gates.

safety_critical_override.description: For systems under DO-178C (DAL A through DAL C), all skills default to arena-run with N=3 regardless of their configured risk level.
safety_critical_override.applies_to: DO-178C DAL A, DAL B, DAL C
